jobs.description:
We’re looking for a highly skilled and imaginative Senior Visual Designer to join the fashion and beauty vertical in Amazon.in. In this role, you'll drive the visual identity and creative execution for a wide range of campaigns across digital and offline platforms. You’ll work closely with marketing, brand, merchandising, and product teams to deliver stunning, effective, and customer-obsessed creative that speaks to a dynamic, trend-forward audience.

Key job responsibilities
Own and evolve the visual design language for the fashion & beauty category requirements.
Lead design strategy & execution for events, stores, product launches, promotions, offsite assets and brand collaborations.
Translate business goals, customer insights, and cultural trends into compelling visual narratives.
Mentor and guide a team of graphic designers, illustrators, and editors.
Review and approve creative work to ensure consistency, quality, and performance.
Collaborate with copywriters, merchandising, and marketing teams to deliver cohesive storytelling across channels.
Stay on top of design trends, pop culture, and ecommerce innovations to keep creative fresh and relevant.
Balance speed and craft—executing high-quality work under tight deadlines.

About the team
The Brand and Creative team is a group of marketers, graphic designers, program managers, copywriters, curators and creative thinkers. The team comprises of the following charters - Curation, Content, Copy and Design. Together, we collaboratively plan and execute the creative direction for all Fashion and Beauty led editorial, category, central, product (UX), influencer-led initiatives In line with our vision to make Amazon Fashion India’s largest and most loved destination for fashion and beauty shopping.

jobs.description:
About the Role
Amazon Fashion & Beauty is seeking an Art Director to define and scale the creative vision for one of the fastest-growing categories on Amazon.in. In this role, you’ll own the visual identity across campaigns, brand launches, and key events—translating insights, trends, and customer needs into impactful, high-quality creatives. You’ll raise the bar for visual excellence, invent new ways to improve visual CX, tell category stories, and drive consistency and innovation across every touchpoint.


Key job responsibilities
Key Responsibilities
Define and evolve the visual design language for Fashion & Beauty, ensuring a consistent and inspiring customer experience.
Lead the end-to-end creative strategy and execution for sale events, strategic projects, marquee launches, seasonal campaigns, brand collaborations, and store experiences.
Partner closely with marketing, category, and product teams to align creative decisions with business goals and customer insights.
Invent and simplify creative processes to drive efficiency without compromising on quality.
Raise the bar by mentoring and developing a team of designers—providing direction, feedback, and clarity to ensure creative excellence.
Review, critique, and approve creative work, maintaining high standards for design quality, storytelling, and brand coherence.
Stay ahead of cultural, fashion, and design trends to bring fresh thinking and relevance to every campaign.
Manage multiple priorities and deliver high-quality creative at speed and scale.


About the team
The Brand and Creative team is a group of marketers, graphic designers, program managers, copywriters, curators and creative thinkers. The team comprises of the following charters - Curation, Content, Copy and Design. Together, we collaboratively plan and execute the creative direction for all Fashion and Beauty led editorial, category, central, product (UX), influencer-led initiatives In line with our vision to make Amazon Fashion India’s largest and most loved destination for fashion and beauty shopping.

jobs.description:
Our Reliability Maintenance Engineering (RME) team is central to Amazon's commitment to innovation. As Amazon evolves and adapts, this team makes sure that the tools and technologies we use do as well. As a Senior RME Technician, you'll help us stay one step ahead, adopting the latest technologies and identifying new and efficient ways of working. In this role, you’ll pay close attention to our processes to help maintain our high standards, and you’ll put in place upgrades to take that standard even higher.

Key job responsibilities
• Demonstrate best practice on using equipment safely and monitor teams to ensure everyone follows the correct processes
• Keep track of equipment performance through visual checks, condition-based monitoring, and preventative maintenance tasks and schedule additional servicing when required
• Supervise technicians on shift to support their development and act as the first point of contact for Reliability Maintenance Engineers
• Solve issues in equipment to reduce downtime for operations so they can process packages as quickly as possible
• Support in finding ways to continually improve systems and standardise processes across the EU network


A day in the life
In every shift, you’ll be leading a team to make sure everyone has the equipment they need and that it’s running properly. That involves monitoring processes so that regulations and policies are followed and ensuring that preventative maintenance is carried out to increase equipment uptime.

With everything you observe on your shifts, you’ll suggest improvements to make our systems more efficient and productive and then implement those improvements across an EU-wide function. You’ll also be monitoring processes with tools like Scada to guarantee their performance, as well as working closely with your line manager to assist with admin tasks.

This role is located at one of our operational sites. You’ll work shift patterns, which may include some weekends and nights. As you develop your experience within this exciting part of Amazon, you’ll be well-placed to progress into more senior roles.

About the team
Our Reliability Maintenance Engineering or RME team keep our equipment performing at its best. We're a technically minded team, made up of excellent team players and guided by experienced leaders. We work together to maintain, troubleshoot and repair equipment across our global network of fulfilment centres. Some of our people are leaders, who oversee the team as they work on exciting technology – some of which only exists at Amazon.

From installing automated packaging systems to overseeing the general maintenance of a site to repairing key distribution equipment, our team handles most aspects of Amazon’s technical side. This includes keeping buildings legally compliant, so everyone is safe, and our sites are operating at maximum efficiency. There are lots of opportunities for progression, both within the RME team and more widely across Amazon.

Everything we do focuses on reducing downtime in Amazon’s crucial operations sites, so customers get their orders on time. We often work during early or late hours to carry out maintenance with minimal disruption, including night shifts. If we spot a better way to do something, we have the skills and the opportunity to develop and introduce completely new processes or cutting-edge tech like Amazon Robotics and our Complex Item Sorter.
jobs.description_short: Our Reliability Maintenance Engineering (RME) team is central to Amazon's commitment to innovation. As Amazon evolves and adapts, this team makes sure that the tools and technologies we use do as well.

jobs.description:
Interested in innovating to deliver world-class service to Amazon's Selling Partners? Marketplace Innovation (MPI) is seeking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the Strategic Account Services (SAS). SAS is designed to improve the Selling Partner experience on Amazon and accelerate their growth through holistic account management by SAS Merchant Consultants working directly with Selling Partners to increase the value, choice, and convenience of their business. Our team will invent and innovate through technology, expand programs to improve Selling Partner engagement and satisfaction, and enable global solutions by working with the US, EU and China teams. We are seeking a Senior Product Manager, Tech Service Offering to develop and scale our SAS business launched in 2020. This role will be responsible for continuously improving Selling Partner experience by enhancing SAS tech service offering to dynamically grow our Selling Partner business. You will be expected to develop new paid product as well as to improve productivity of existing ones to achieve the business outcome based on a clear analysis of the voice of the Selling Partners and the market. You will play a key role in developing our portfolio of SAS tech solutions with tech team in JP and cross-functional teams and colleagues in JP, US, EU and China. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, be able to scrutinize ambiguous situations, define and build logic and mechanisms based on large data sets, owning the projects end-to-end with multiple stakeholders, and deliver results.

Key job responsibilities
- Improve Selling Partners growth and satisfaction through designing product and tech service offering that meet the demand of Selling Partners
- Design, develop, and track the effectiveness of product and tech service offerings that meet the needs of Selling Partners, continuously validating and improving their experience and business growth.
- Identify, assess, and improve the optimal cost to serve in order to ensure profitability while meeting Selling Partners requirements. Validate and optimize the fee model for sustained operation of the paid business.
- Collaborate with domestic and global tech teams to actively incorporate their best practices and develop high-impact products.
- Independently drive product roadmap from end to end to deliver results, working with tech and non-tech stakeholders.
- Responsible for documentation for new service launches, business reviews and annual plans.
- Operates in autonomously and seeks leadership input / guidance on decisions impacting the broader business.
jobs.description_short: Interested in innovating to deliver world-class service to Amazon's Selling Partners? Marketplace Innovation (MPI) is seeking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the Strategic Account Services (SAS).

jobs.description:
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our Software Development Engineers (SDEs) use technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand. The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and influence millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company where development cycles are measured in weeks, not years. If this sounds interesting to you, apply and come chart your own path at Amazon.
Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. NOTE: Amazon works with a high volume of applicants, so we appreciate your patience as we review applications

Key job responsibilities
Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring innovative products and services to market.
• Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
• Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
• Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
• Design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
• Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software.

jobs.description:
Amazon.in's Fulfilment by Amazon (FBA) team is seeking for a talented, self-driven and experienced Senior Business Intelligence Engineer to lead its advanced analytics wing for FBA Product and Business team. This pivotal role provides you opportunity to work with an exceptionally innovative team, slice and dice multi-dimensional high depth data mines, build complex data models to provide data driven insights for high impact decisions spanning across Merchant and Customer experience improvement Product/Program initiatives.

Are you customer obsessed, flexible, smart and analytical, strategic yet execution focused and passionate about e-commerce? Are you an experienced, entrepreneurial leader with a strong work ethic? If yes, this opportunity will appeal to you.

To be successful in this role, you will have the ability to roll up your sleeves, innovate, and quickly become a subject matter expert to assess business performance across sellers and market segments.
You will be a self-starter who is willing to work hands-on, is comfortable with ambiguity and large data sets. You will be part of the Central Analytics team working with Stakeholders, Data Engineers, Business Intelligence Engineers and Business Analysts to achieve our goals. You will also have strong communication skills, be able to work closely with stakeholders and translate data-driven findings into actionable insights.

You will have demonstrated proficiency in SQL across variety of databases, BI tools, R or Python to analyze large data sets.

Key job responsibilities
Passionate about working with huge data sets and be someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions. You should have deep expertise in creation and management of datasets Exposure at implementing and operating stable, scalable data flow solutions from production systems into end-user facing applications/reports. These solutions will be fault tolerant, self-healing and adaptive.
Detail-oriented and must have an aptitude for solving unstructured problems. You should work in a self-directed environment, own tasks and drive them to completion.
Excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions

jobs.description:
Amazon's Global Operations Services & Support (GOSS) Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical is seeking a highly talented and motivated Risk Manager III to own complex data governance programs within the Enterprise Data Governance & Standards function—a critical team that defines policies, ownership models, validation standards, and quality thresholds that turn operational data into a strategic asset suitable for capital allocation, market entry analysis, and portfolio planning.
A successful candidate for this role will have an established background in risk management, strong technical acumen with data governance frameworks and master data management, experience leveraging AI/ML for data quality validation, along with excellent project management and communication skills. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to operate independently with limited guidance in ambiguous problem spaces, building consensus across Director-level organizations while creating predictable data governance standards and process paths.

Key job responsibilities
• Own and deliver complex data governance programs that span multiple teams or focus on critical data domains (e.g., implementing master data frameworks; building data validation rules for AI-driven decisions; establishing data lineage tracking across operational systems)
• Manage the full lifecycle of initiatives from idea through design, approval, build, launch, iteration, and deprecation
• Find path forward in difficult situations where technical solutions, stakeholder alignment, or resource availability is unclear
• Identify opportunities where data governance automation could unlock business value or remove perceived risk blockers
• Oversee rollout of data governance controls and audits, including testing and measuring effectiveness of data validation mechanisms, data quality rules, and master data management processes
• Balance customer experience against risk management concerns in data governance framework design
• Influence roadmaps, business and technology decisions across CDI functions and partner organizations
• Contribute to risk-related policies and contracts that govern data governance implementation
• Write clear and compelling narratives (6-pagers, PR/FAQs) that explain data governance programs and their business impact
• Present effectively to Directors and VPs on program status, risks, and recommendations
• Drive efficiencies in how data governance is delivered and maintained
• Create predictable controls and process paths that teams can follow independently

A day in the life
Amazon Benefits:
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4. 401(k) Plan
If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

About the team
The Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical under GOSS ensures Amazon's operations are compliant, resilient, and built on trusted data. The Enterprise Data Governance & Standards function is the backbone of data credibility across Operations, defining what good looks like for data—not the systems or business recommendations that rely on it. This function establishes master data governance frameworks for critical entity types with validation rules for AI-driven decisions, preventing AI models from making recommendations based on ungoverned or stale data.

jobs.description:
Amazon's Global Operations Services & Support (GOSS) Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical is seeking a highly talented and motivated Risk Manager III to own complex compliance operations programs within the Compliance Operations & Controls function—a critical team that makes CDI compliant day-to-day across 4K+ facilities, 50+ regulatory frameworks, and 34K+ data points, executing compliance frameworks, monitoring controls, supporting audits, and remediating issues.
A successful candidate for this role will have an established background in risk management, strong technical acumen with compliance management systems and control frameworks, experience leveraging automation for compliance monitoring, along with excellent project management and communication skills. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to operate independently with limited guidance in ambiguous problem spaces, building consensus across Director-level organizations while creating predictable compliance controls and process paths.
The candidate will also have a proven track record of managing and mentoring team members, with a strong focus on operational excellence, process improvement, and measurable customer satisfaction.

Key job responsibilities
• Own and deliver complex compliance operations programs that span multiple teams or focus on critical compliance areas (e.g., implementing unified licenses and permits compliance management platform, building automated compliance monitoring dashboards, establishing audit support mechanisms across regions)
• Manage the full lifecycle of initiatives from idea through design, approval, build, launch, iteration, and deprecation
• Negotiate and define obligations with stakeholders, setting clear program objectives and success metrics
• Unblock teams and increase speed of delivery by identifying and resolving technical, organizational, or resource constraints
• Identify opportunities where compliance automation could unlock business value or remove perceived risk blockers
• Oversee rollout of compliance controls and audits, including testing and measuring effectiveness of automated compliance monitoring mechanisms
• Influence roadmaps, business and technology decisions across CDI functions and partner organizations
• Write clear and compelling narratives (6-pagers, PR/FAQs) that explain compliance operations programs and their business impact
• Present effectively to Directors and VPs on program status, risks, and recommendations
• Improve, streamline, and/or eliminate excess processes or controls that create friction without adding value
• Drive efficiencies in how compliance operations are delivered and maintained
• Create predictable controls and process paths that teams can follow independently
• Review metrics proactively to identify areas for improvement
• Seek new/improved visibility mechanisms to measure compliance operations effectiveness


A day in the life
Amazon Benefits:
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4. 401(k) Plan
If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

About the team
The Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical under GOSS ensures Amazon's operations are compliant, resilient, and built on trusted data. The Compliance Operations & Controls function makes CDI compliant day-to-day across 4K+ facilities, 50+ regulatory frameworks, and 34K+ data points, executing compliance frameworks, monitoring controls, supporting audits, and remediating issues.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 6+ years of compliance, audit or risk management experience
- 5+ years of program or project Management experience
- Knowledge of Microsoft Office products and applications at an advanced level
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent
jobs.description:
Amazon's Global Operations Services & Support (GOSS) Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical is seeking a highly talented and motivated Risk Manager III to own complex risk quantification and business continuity programs within the Global Risk & Business Continuity function—a critical team that quantifies and contextualizes operational risk to influence strategic decisions across the $50B+ infrastructure portfolio, translating disruptions, vulnerabilities, and resilience gaps into financial and operational impact scenarios.
A successful candidate for this role will have an established background in risk management, strong analytical acumen with risk modeling and scenario planning, experience leveraging quantitative methods for risk assessment, along with excellent project management and communication skills. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to operate independently with limited guidance in ambiguous problem spaces, building consensus across Director-level organizations while creating predictable risk assessment frameworks and process paths.
The candidate will also have a proven track record of managing and mentoring team members, with a strong focus on operational excellence, process improvement, and measurable customer satisfaction.


Key job responsibilities
• Own and deliver complex risk quantification programs that span multiple teams or focus on critical risk areas (e.g., implementing integrated risk assessment models across regions, building scenario planning frameworks for operational disruptions, establishing business continuity protocols for critical facilities)
• Manage the full lifecycle of initiatives from idea through design, approval, build, launch, iteration, and deprecation
• Negotiate and define obligations with stakeholders, setting clear program objectives and success metrics
• Unblock teams and increase speed of delivery by identifying and resolving analytical, organizational, or resource constraints
• Identify opportunities where risk modeling could unlock business value or inform strategic investment decisions
• Partner with internal/external legal teams, policy owners, and regulators to fully understand and interpret risk drivers, regulatory requirements, and business constraints relevant to operational risk management
• Oversee development of risk quantification models and scenario planning frameworks, including testing and measuring effectiveness of risk assessment methodologies
• Provide long-term perspective and context for risk-related business and technology decisions involving operational resilience
• Influence roadmaps, business and technology decisions across CDI functions and partner organizations
• Contribute to risk-related policies and contracts that govern risk management implementation
• Write clear and compelling narratives (6-pagers, PR/FAQs) that explain risk quantification programs and their business impact
• Present effectively to Directors and VPs on risk assessments, scenario analyses, and strategic recommendations
• Drive efficiencies in how risk assessments are conducted and maintained
• Create predictable risk assessment frameworks that teams can follow independently


A day in the life
Amazon Benefits:
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4. 401(k) Plan
If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

jobs.description:
Amazon is seeking a Program Manager to support project planning and execution for the continued capacity expansion of our Global Fulfillment network. The primary role of this individual on the Project Management (PMO) team is to drive capacity projects to completion keeping them on schedule. Candidates will work with each phase of the project life cycle including build requirements, fulfillment design, planning, execution, and Launch/hand-off.

This individual will work with Capacity Planning partners to validate project requests, work with Engineering Design to coordinate proposals and milestone schedules, work with Procurement to help release purchase orders, and work with field teams to coordinate kick off meetings, and support with ongoing execution risk reporting & mitigation.






Key job responsibilities
- Facilitate/run weekly alignment meetings on network projects as well as program specific updates
- Partner with critical planning teams on project milestones (Real Estate, Capacity, Capital, Design, Startup, Robotics)
- Review Material Handling and Storage proposals for acceptable milestone schedules
- Update/maintain weekly network Engineering Project Tracker, and support Resource tracking
- Drive/follow up on milestone level delays
- Support Build Plan presentations
- Input and coordinate with Real Estate construction, Robotics, and Material Handling vendors on First Access details
- Initiate/facilitate major project kick-offs and support hand-off from planning teams to execution teams
- Escalate milestone level project issues that are impacting project schedules
- Report on engineering project updates to Senior Leadership, planning, and execution teams
- Provide Inputs and support on Program/Project Management tools and processes
- Miscellaneous support tasks (Project Data, Reporting, Whitepaper inputs, etc.)

A day in the life
Amazon Benefits:
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)
4. 401(k) Plan
If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!
